Sentencas: Cu-based electrodes could advance solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) technology due to good electric conductivity and relatively high electrochemical activity among transition metals.
Titulo: Stability and activity controls of Cu nanoparticles for high-performance solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, one of the main challenges for designing anode materials is thermal stability in SOFC operation condition.
Titulo: Stability and activity controls of Cu nanoparticles for high-performance solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Herein, a promising anode material decorated with Cu nanoparticles (NPs) was synthesized via in-situ exsolution from La0.43Sr0.37Cu0.12Ti0.88O3-delta (LSCuT) perovskite.
Titulo: Stability and activity controls of Cu nanoparticles for high-performance solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Compared to infiltration process, Cu NPs prepared by in-situ exsolution displayed homogeneous nano size distribution on the substrate and excellent thermal stability at 600 degrees C in H-2 atmosphere, for similar to 50 h.
Titulo: Stability and activity controls of Cu nanoparticles for high-performance solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, we employed electrochemical reduction (ER) at 2.3 V for a few seconds to demonstrate that NPs can be rapidly grown, and the substrate reduced.
Titulo: Stability and activity controls of Cu nanoparticles for high-performance solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A single cell with LSCuT anode (10 mu m)parallel to ScSZ electrolyte (90 mu m)parallel to LSM-ScSZ cathode (20 mu m) exhibits maximum power density of 1.38 Wcm(-2) at 900 degrees C under wet H-2.
Titulo: Stability and activity controls of Cu nanoparticles for high-performance solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The present study provides possibility of a broad application of thermally stable Cu-based electrodes.
Titulo: Stability and activity controls of Cu nanoparticles for high-performance solid oxide fuel cells
